headline: Courtney Everts Mykytyn, 46, School Integration Crusader
abstract: She challenged privileged white parents to send their children to schools with predominantly black and Latino student bodies.
lead_paragraph: Courtney Everts Mykytyn, a California activist who battled educational segregation by urging white parents like herself to send their children to public schools with largely black and Latino student bodies, died on Dec. 30 when she was struck by a car in Los Angeles. She was 46.
